prompt:
Nurse: I'm glad to hear that, Ms. Peck. How about a new or worsening dry cough?

Patient: No.

Nurse: That's good to hear, Ms. Peck. Have you noticed any increased swelling in your feet, ankles, stomach, or legs?

Patient: No.

Nurse: That's great, Ms. Peck. Have you gained more than 2 pounds in the past day or 5 pounds in the past week?

Patient: No.

Nurse: That's good to hear, Ms. Peck. Lastly, have you been using more pillows at night to sleep?

Patient: No.

responses.gpt4: That's good to hear, Ms. Peck. Please continue to monitor these things as they are important indicators of your CHF. Remember, keeping track of your symptoms can be overwhelming. Do you have any questions about how to do this?
responses.our_model: That's great, Ms. Peck. We just performed a simple CHF assessment. It's a good idea to keep an eye on these symptoms at home every day. I understand that keeping track of symptoms can be complicated. Do you have any questions about how to do so?
